conclusion: Need to analyze the path of the liquid as it flows down the inclined surface.
Liquid will flow downward due to gravity.
Liquid will follow the path of least resistance, generally the steepest downhill direction.
Baffle A is positioned to direct the liquid towards the right side of the surface.
Baffle B is positioned to direct the liquid further to the right.
Baffle C continues to direct the liquid to the right.
Liquid will first encounter baffle A and be directed to the right.
Liquid will encounter baffle B, which will continue to direct it further to the right.
Liquid will encounter baffle C, which will direct it even more to the right.
After passing through all three baffles, the liquid will have been consistently directed to the right.
The rightmost container is container E.
The liquid will flow into container E after passing through baffles A, B, and C.
